## Priority Legend

- **High**: Critical controls used frequently, need immediate attention (complete rewrite needed)
- **Medium**: Important controls with some existing content, need significant updates
- **Low**: Specialized controls with less usage, minimal updates needed

## Missing Content Types

**Common Issues Across All Controls:**

- ❌ **Outdated Metadata**: All controls reference 2017 dates and .NET Framework
- ❌ **Old Screenshots**: Windows XP/Vista era styling (where screenshots exist)
- ❌ **Minimal Content**: Most articles are stub-level with basic descriptions only
- ❌ **No Code Examples**: Missing practical XAML and C# examples
- ❌ **No Template Parts**: Missing customization and styling guidance
- ❌ **No Best Practices**: Missing performance and accessibility guidance

**Content Quality Levels:**

- **Minimal content**: Basic description only, typically 5-15 lines
- **Better content structure**: Has overview sections and some examples
- **Good comprehensive content**: Detailed examples and usage scenarios (DataGrid only)

## Notes

1. **File Path Format**: All paths are relative to the repository root (`c:\Users\adegeo\code\dotnet\docs-desktop\`)
2. **Total Control Count**: Updated from 54 to 46 controls based on actual existing documentation files
3. **Missing Controls**: Some controls mentioned in the original plan may not have dedicated documentation files or may be covered in overview articles
4. **Priority Order**: Controls are listed in the same category order as defined in the project plan for easy cross-reference

## Usage

This reference file can be used for:

- **Batch processing**: Iterate through all control files programmatically
- **Progress tracking**: Update priority column as work progresses
- **Content gap analysis**: Identify specific missing content types for each control
- **Work prioritization**: Focus on high-priority controls first
- **Resource allocation**: Estimate work effort by missing content complexity
- **Project planning**: Plan phases based on priority distribution

## Key Insights

- **20 controls (43%)** require complete rewrites due to minimal existing content
- **18 controls (39%)** need significant updates but have some foundation to build on
- **8 controls (17%)** need only minor updates or metadata refreshing
- **Input Controls category** has highest concentration of high-priority items
- **Document Controls category** has mostly low-priority specialized controls
- **DataGrid** is the only control with comprehensive existing content

## Maintenance

- Update the **Priority** column as controls are modernized
- Add new controls when they are documented
- Verify file paths periodically to catch any reorganization
- Keep category assignments synchronized with the main project plan
